Headline: Sr. Business Process Consultant
Text: Is it safe to assume that you can hook to a devops change model for audit purposes?
Bio: IT Professional in one way or another Since 1995. Spent 20 years helping to Launch Space shuttles. SN CSA - CIS x 2, and  ITIL 4 Master amongst a lot of other certs.  Using SN since Fuji!

Text: We haven't got a dedicated integration with DevOps Change yet but are working with those teams. We do integrate with Change Management, and have tooling for building whatever custom integrations you need. (Also, would love to hear what integrations are top of mind for users, as we look at what is important for us to connect with!)

Text: Free with the platform, correct - no separate licensing or costs.
What's the relationship between Agile 2.0 releases and ReleaseOps Releases?

Unfortunately, Release is a heavily used word in this space - there's no connection to the Agile 2.0 Release (I think we're up to 4 Releases in ServiceNow, but we felt this was better than a cutesy custom name)

Headline: Principal Technical Consultant @ Bravium
Text: Do the deployment requests and subsequent releases honor the approved change window?
Bio: SN enthusiast and soon to be dad

Text: Yes. In Zurich the integration is admittedly a little light (but will evolve) - but it at least will honor the change window times, and cancelations in Change will cancel a ReleaseOps Release, and vice versa.

Headline: Principal Technical Consultant @ Bravium
Text: what happens to deployment requests that get stuck outside of the change window if they weren't completed? Can they get moved to a new release?
Bio: SN enthusiast and soon to be dad

Headline: Principal Technical Consultant @ Bravium
Text: looks like yes on the form
Bio: SN enthusiast and soon to be dad

Text: If the Release has started, or the move of those Update Sets, those will continue - we don't want to try to abort something that's being moved.
